name: github
label: GitHub
description: GitHub is a code hosting platform for collaboration and version control. This connector facilitates automated interactions with Github, such as to create and manage repositories, branches, issues, pull requests, and many more.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: Specify the URL of the GitHub server to connect and perform automated operations

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.description: Specify the username used to access the GitHub server to connect and perform the automated operations

fields.title: Personal Access Token
fields.name: password
fields.description: Specify the Personal Access Token used to access the GitHub server to connect and perform the automated operations

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set to True
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set to True

fields.title: Clone URL
fields.name: clone_url
fields.description: Specify the clone URL of the GitHub server to connect and perform cloned operation

operations.title: Create Repository
operations.description: Creates a new organization or an authenticated user repository based on the repository type, organization or repository owner's name, and other input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on GitHub, where you want to create the repository, in the Organization Name field
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on GitHub, where you want to create the repository, in the Organization Name field

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: owner
User.tooltip: Select this option to create the repository under the username specified in the connector configuration
User.description: Select this option to create the repository under the username specified in the connector configuration

parameters.tooltip: Select the method from the following options using which you want to create the repository on GitHub
parameters.description: Select the method from the following options using which you want to create the repository on GitHub

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository you want to create on GitHub
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository you want to create on GitHub

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: Specify a short description of the repository you want to create on GitHub
parameters.description: Specify a short description of the repository you want to create on GitHub

parameters.title: Homepage
parameters.name: homepage
parameters.tooltip: Specify the homepage of the repository you want to create on GitHub. A Homepage is a URL that contains more information about the repository
parameters.description: Specify the homepage of the repository you want to create on GitHub. A Homepage is a URL that contains more information about the repository

parameters.title: Private
parameters.name: private
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to create a Private repository on GitHub. Clear this option to create a Public repository on GitHub
parameters.description: Select this option to create a Private repository on GitHub. Clear this option to create a Public repository on GitHub

parameters.title: Has Issues
parameters.name: has_issues
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to enable issues for the repository you want to create on GitHub. Clear this option to disable issues for the repository you want to create on GitHub
parameters.description: Select this option to enable issues for the repository you want to create on GitHub. Clear this option to disable issues for the repository you want to create on GitHub

parameters.title: Has Projects
parameters.name: has_projects
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to enable projects for the repository you want to create on GitHub. Clear this option to disable projects for the repository you want to create on GitHub
parameters.description: Select this option to enable projects for the repository you want to create on GitHub. Clear this option to disable projects for the repository you want to create on GitHub

parameters.title: Has Wiki
parameters.name: has_wiki
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to enable the wiki for the repository you want to create on GitHub; this is the default. Clear this option to disable the wiki for the repository you want to create on GitHub
parameters.description: Select this option to enable the wiki for the repository you want to create on GitHub; this is the default. Clear this option to disable the wiki for the repository you want to create on GitHub

parameters.title: Is Template
parameters.name: is_template
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to make the repository you are creating available as a template repository on GitHub. Clear this option to prevent the repository you are creating from being available as a template repository on GitHub
parameters.description: Select this option to make the repository you are creating available as a template repository on GitHub. Clear this option to prevent the repository you are creating from being available as a template repository on GitHub

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify fields in the JSON format to be used as Search criteria (used to determine dynamic membership) fields or as link fields
parameters.description: Specify fields in the JSON format to be used as Search criteria (used to determine dynamic membership) fields or as link fields
parameters.name: other_fields

operations.title: Create Repository Using Template
operations.description: Creates a new repository using a template based on the template owner, template repository name, new repository name, and other input parameters you have specified

parameters.name: template_owner

parameters.description: Specify the name of the template owner of the repository you want to create on GitHub

parameters.description: Specify the name of the template repository using which you want to create this repository on GitHub

parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository you want to create on GitHub

parameters.title: New Repository Owner
parameters.name: owner

parameters.description: Specify the name of the organization or person who will own the new repository

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: Specify a short description of the repository you want to create on GitHub

parameters.title: Private
parameters.name: private
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to create a private repository on GitHub. By default, this option is cleared and hence creates a public repository on GitHub
parameters.description: Select this option to create a private repository on GitHub. By default, this option is cleared and hence creates a public repository on GitHub
